body: This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
Anything from the maintainers on this one?
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!

We also just moved to azure and ran into the same problem. We use pgbouncer as sidecars to improve the latency and a simple solution for us was to remap usernames in pgbouncer.

I think for the PR if we modify the `_get_alembic_config` function and the migration methods in `store/db_migrations/env.py`, we should be fine. The latter need to reverse the percentage escaping.

I can create a PR for this but not sure if this is the right solution?

Kind of hard to say. The maintainers don't seem to have much time to interact with issues or PRs...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/424192/66109956-9e5d3900-e5bd-11e9-8290-e27df9e10858.png)

Got much love for the project but it's a bit concerning to see so many issues and PRs unattended.

Any updates ? This is a proble for us too

I've actually stopped using mlflow. lots of good benefits but having my issue (which other folks are having as well apparently) go unattended for so long, even when it includes a proposed fix is just not great :( we've rolled our own to hold us over and are now experimenting with dvc which is looking promising.
